inn1.comm: short of a length, outside off, left alone
short of a length, angling in, defended from the crease
punched away nicely off the back foot as Irfan pitches shortish again. Fielded at short cover
short of a length, outside off, nicely punched to cover-point
short of a length, 148ks, just outside off, rises high towards the ribs, defended to cover-point
slips in the yorker and appeals for a return catch as Perera digs this out back to him. Ian Gould doesn't even consult the third umpire on this. A clear bump ball according to him. Maiden over
and Dilshan plays him for the inswing first up, but this one holds its line outside off to beat his outside edge
this one comes in with the angle, pushed wide of mid-on for a single
on a length, angling towards off, defended back to him
that's not clever. Fine leg is up in the circle, and Anwar has bowled outside leg. Easily glanced fine of that man in the circle
fuller, closer to off, nicely driven down the ground to mid-on
short of a length, at the stumps, no room, punched back to him
short of a length, 143ks, good carry. Dilshan leaves it on bounce
fuller, middle and leg, gets an inside edge onto the pad
short of a length, at the stumps, played with soft hands towards mid-off and sets off immediately for a single that Perera is not quite sure of. They go through with it, and Dilshan makes it
short of a length, outside off, rides the bounce and runs this down to third man
short and wide, Dilshan needs no second invitations. Cut in front of square, with the wind, easy four
on a length, on off, pushed to mid-off
full and on the pads, but there is a deep square leg to keep this down to one
short of a length, left alone outside off
short of a length, outside off, looks to pull it, and is beaten on the under edge
some swing finally, beats the bat as Dilshan whips across the line of a length ball. Big shout for lbw. No edge, height is good, but this is headed down
presses forward, uses soft hands to play this length ball towards mid-on, and steals a single
offcutter, on a length, middle and off, push-driven between mid-off and extra cover. The wind almost carries it to the fence
low full toss outside off, and he has crashed this through point with an open-faced drive. Into the wind this time, but it doesn't matter. This is timed superbly
short of a length, outside off, he gets behind it and defends
short of a length, 145ks, angling in, dropped into the leg side for a single
good sharp bouncer, DIlshan is clearly late into the pull, gloves it, but it falls safe in the short fine leg area
nice punchy drive but straight to the fielder at extra cover
short of a length, outside off, Perera looks to punch it away, inside-edges it to the left of Irfan who fields and has a shy at the stumps, hitting Perera in the process
on a length, outside off, driven to mid-off
driven nicely again, but straight back to Anwar
slower ball, offcutter, and not for the first time today he has taken a single to mid-on. He has pushed those fielders today
on a length, on off, superb drive. This is not a half-volley. He has driven this on the up, and with an open face so as to find the gap between point and cover-point
not very convincing this time. Short of a length, just outside off, he punches it, but in the air. It is the wind that takes it over the man at cover. That takes him to 1000 career runs
slower offcutter, around the pads, defended back to him
length ball outside off, driven on the up, but straight to short cover
soft hands again, and straight of mid-off too. Dilshan gets yet another single. He has been good with that
short of a length, 140ks, nips in, beats him for pace, hits him high on the pad. The ball rolls towards third man
short, 145ks, only chest high, and Dilshan rocks back to pull it away for four. Dilshan has earned this loose delivery by annoying the bowlers with those short singles off good balls
another loose ball, a slower ball gone wrong. A leg-side half-volley this is, and Dilshan has driven it through midwicket. Even though it has to go into the wind, it makes the journey to the fence
short of a length, middle and off, Dilshan leaves it on bounce
slower offcutter, hit uppishly but it bounces well short of cover
length ball, on the pads, pushed straight of short midwicket, and steals another single
short of a length, pretty straight, Dilshan looks to work this to leg, but all he manages is an inside edge onto the pad
slower ball, 113ks, slightly short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man
slower ball again, and he has got away with this one. This is short, and on the pads with the fine leg up in the circle. Perera somehow finds that man as he pulls behind square
on a length, regulation pace, pushed wide of mid-off for one
short of a length, outside off, superb shot. Perera doesn't have the room, but he opens the face late, and uses the pace of the ball to beat third man to his left
short of a length, angling in, pushed between the two men deep on the leg side, and the come back for the second
short of a length, at the stumps, defended back to him
that's Jayasuriya reprise. This is a length ball angling in, Perera opens the front leg and lofts this over midwicket. With the wind it flies
Rahat gets away with this one. This is short, this is wide, and Perera loves it. Just goes too hard with the cut, and hits it hard into the ground off the bottom edge. Gets a single to third man
length ball outside off, defended to cover-point
short of a length, no room, pushed between point and cover-point

poor cricket from Anwar. Short of a length, pushed back to his left, Dilshan is back in the crease, but Anwar throws at him and misses. The throw is so wild it has bisected the keeper and the short fine leg. Jest desserts, those four penalty runs
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover-point
slower ball, short of a length, 113ks, cut away to point
short of a length, pushed just to the right of midwicket, and they hustle through for one again. The ricochet off the stumps allows them another run
short of a length, angling in, tucked away off the hip for one
short and wide, deserves to go for four but takes an alternative route. Off the bottom edge and past the diving keeper this goes. Dilshan suggests the ball skidded on and stayed a touch low
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
short of a length, into the body, pulled to long leg
short of a length, on off, he is on the front foot to defend
on a length, outside off, driven hard into the ground, and the ball bounces over the man at cover for a couple
on a length, quick, around off, defended to cover
and Perera plays the reverse sweep to use the wind. At any rate Wasim has darted this in. And he just switches sides to place this past point for four
slightly slower but also shorter, cut away to deep cover for one
Dilshan has been bowled by Wasim after being beaten on the inside edge, but he tries to cut a fullish ball again. This time the underside edge lands safely
stays back to cut a length-ball again. Gets a single to deep cover
Perera makes room to punch a flat ball to deep cover
on a length, just outside off, defended
stays back to defend a flatter delivery outside off

Perera gets to his fifty with a streaky four. He sweeps from in front of the stumps, gets a top edge that a man more agile than Mohammad Irfan would have taken at short fine leg. Just not quick enough to move, and doesn't dive either as the ball lobs over his head, and the wind takes it away for four
tossed up outside off, defended
slightly flatter, defended again

They are reviewing this not-out call on the lbw appeal. Another unconvincing sweep from Perera, seems like he is beaten and is hit in front but the replays reveal he has gloved it, thus costing Pakistan the review
flat, into the pads, pushed down to long-on for one
down the wicket, nearly beaten in the flight, gets an inside edge back to the bowler
stays back expecting a shorter delivery. Even though this is not short, he has managed to place it to deep point for one
arm ball, Dilshan stays back to punch it down to long-off for one

Ian Gould can't get out of the way. Perera presses forward and then rocks back to cut this dead square. Gould seems to have spotted this late, and fails to avoid it. Thankfully there was a fielder behind him, and Sri Lanka would have got just the single anyway
goes back to cut a length ball but can't beat point
down the wicket too early, Malik shortens the length, Perera gets a leading edge back to Malik but on the bounce
rocks back to cut a length ball, but finds the man at point
really slow in the air, middle and leg, pushed to long-on with soft hands. "Double double double" is the initial call, but they have to settle with the one
Dilshan looks to work this to leg, gets a soft leading edge between the two deep fielders in the off side. Gets a couple
down the wicket, and defends this back to him
pitched outside leg, worked around the corner for one
fired down the leg side for a wide. Good collection by Sarfraz
half-volley, driven to long-on
lovely shot. He is out of the crease in a flash, right down to the pitch of this flat delivery, and sends it smack straight back over the bowler's head for a flat six

yet another flat six. Perera is in the mood here. He leaves the crease, Wasim tosses this up wide after seeing him come, but Perera throws his hands at it and goes ahead with the shot with the knowledge that mid-off is up in the circle
fired into the pads, worked away for a single
looks to work this to leg and closes the face too early. Wasim appeals for the lbw, but this is pitched middle and leg and is headed down with the angle. Gets two leg-byes to third man
into the pads again, worked away for an easy single
leg-side half-volley, driven to long-on for one
stays back to punch this length ball square to point
presses forward early, Malik stays slow in the air, and Perera defends this back to him
again presses forward, Malik is flatter this time, and Perera pushes him into the leg side for one
outside leg again, gloved fine of short fine leg for a single
stays back, pushes a length ball towards long-on for one
on a length, on the pads, worked to leg for one
full, on off, defended to cover
tossed up just outside off, pushed to short cover
length ball, into the pads, worked away for a single
pushed through outside off, no turn, worked away with an open face
tossed up outside off, no turn again, comes back to the bowler off the inside half of the bat
down the wicket, looks to work this to leg, is hit on the pad, but is in no danger of being lbw
worked into the leg side for one
outside leg from round the stumps, worked around the corner for one
flatter, just outside off, looks to work to leg, gets an inside edge onto the pad
flat length ball, outside off, he opens the face. Dilshan knows Irfan is at short third man, and he picks on him to steal a single
tossed up on the pads, defended to leg
flat, on the pads, worked into the leg side
flighted on off, driven to long-off
beaten in the flight as he looks to sweep, but he gets a bottom edge fine of short fine leg
flighted, but still quick at 90ks, pitched outside leg, defended to leg
slower this time at 82ks, worked past midwicket for one
flatter, quicker at 89ks, punched to deep cover
full outside leg, concedes a leg-bye
tossed up outside off, Perera pushes forward and defends
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep midwicket for one
slow through the air, tossed up on middle and leg, Dilshan is right forward in defence
too straight this time, worked into the leg side for one
short of a length, on off, pushed into the leg side
nice dip on this as Perera looks to sweep and finds himself away from the pitch of the ball. leg-bye ensues as the ball rolls to short third man
looks to use the pace of the bowler but can't beat the man at point
goes back to punch a flat ball down to long-off
nearly a stunner. This is hit hard and flat and straight of mid-on. Anwar Ali makes ground to his right, flies towards it, gets his hands to it, but can't hold on
another fifty comes up with a sweep. Shah bowls quick and into the pads, Dilshan is quick to come down on it with the sweep, and beats short fine leg
flat outside off, punched past cover for one
tossed up on off, worked into the leg side to reach 9999 career runs
short of a length, on off, worked to leg for one

short of a length, pitched outside leg, worked around the corner to become the fourth Sri Lankan and the 11th overall to 10000 ODI runs. He acknowledges it immediately, raises his arms, looks towards the sky. Azhar Ali comes to congratulate him. Malik shakes his hand too
short of a length again, worked into the leg side for an easy single
tossed up on the pads, dropped into the leg side for another single
flighted outside off, left alone
short of a length, pitched outside leg, Dilshan early into turning the face of the bat. Hit on the pad
short of a length, no room, pushed back to him
half-volley, just off the timing on the drive, finds short cover
only slightly short, and Dilshan doesn't even rock back when pulling and beats midwicket for four more. All along the ground
length ball, on off, whipped away to long leg for one
heavy ball, short of a length, but down the leg side
short, angling in, he arches back to open the face and guide it fine of third man
short of a length, outside leg, pushed down to long-on for one
flat, outside off, Perera looks to lap it away, is beaten and hit on the arm
nearly a catch. This is shorty and wide, Perera fails to control it, but he has hit it just about straight of the man at cover
shapes up to sweep too early, Malik goes flat and down the leg side, but he still amanges to sweep it fine even though off balance
low full toss outside off, and he has swept this between long leg and deep midwicket for four more. Perera racing away
short, not much width, punched to long-off for one
makes room to dig out a really full delivery towards cover-point

Dilshan has stolen quite a few singles today but he has picked the wrong man this time. Short of a length, just outside off, dropped at his feet, towards cover, charges through for one, Ahmed Shehzad swoops in on it, and throws the stumps at the non-striker's end down. Dilshan is caught well short

oh hello. Out of nowhere Rahat has produced a peach. Digs this one in short, the ball seams back in as Perera looks to sway out of its line, and the ball hits the grille of the helmet. They get a leg-bye
another bouncer, to the new batsman this time, and Thirimanne lets it be outside off
on a length, angling in, towards top of off, defended back to him
short of a length, just outside off, defended to cover
flighted outside off, defended to cover
short of a length, outside off, worked into the leg side for a single
flighted outside off, pushed to extra cover
short of a length, outside off, manages to work it through square leg for one
arm ball, Perera looks to work this to leg, is beaten by the angle but the ball is headed down leg when it hits the pad
flat, short of a length, dropped into the leg side
bouncer, mis-hits the pull, but he gets a single to long leg. A little late into the pull
short of a length, outside off, runs it down to third man
full, into the pads, pushed to mid-on for a single. Goes on to 99
full, middle and off, pushed straight of mid-on to bring Perera back on strike

nails that pull to reach his second ODI hundred. A really good innings. Has hardly taken a risk. Raises his bat immediately. His team-mates stand up for his him. Is congratulated by Shehzad too. How about a double? He has the time
driven past cover as he pitches up outside off
flighted outside off, defended from the crease
shimies down the wicket, yorks himself and digs this out back to him
short of a length, into the pads, gets a single to leg
down the wicket to take this on the full and gets a single to deep midwicket
flatter, punched to the left of Malik but he fields well to deny them the single
this time he stays back to work a shortish delivery into the leg side for one
flat delivery, no room, defended back to him
pushed past midwicket for a single
short of a length, punched down to long-on
worked into the leg side again
looks to run this fine behind the wicket, gets a bottom edge for a single
that double-century is on. Every time Perera has taken the bowling on, he has connected sweetly. Dances down the wicket, reaches the pitch of the ball, and sends it sailing over wide long-on
down the wicket, clips this off his toes, gets a single to deep midwicket
fired into the pads, beats his bat, draws a dot
length ball, outside off, defended to cover
punched down to long-on
really slow in the air, gets some turn, Thiri looks top open the face, but sends it straight to short third
down the wicket to clip this through midwicket for one. A commendable spell of 10-0-44-0 from Malik comes to an end. First time since January 2010 that he has bowled his quote of 10
Thirimanne opens up too. Shimmies down the wicket, takes this on the half-volley, and lofts it back over the bowler's head for four
and he goes after Shah a little more. Leaves the crease, beaten in the flight, but he chips it beautifully over mid-off
flat, into the pads, worked fine for a single
flat, 89ks, middle and off, defended to cover
nice dip on this as Perera pushes forward, but he waits for it to arrive and works it to leg for one
opens the face, takes it from middle and leg, runs this through point for a single
full, outside off, driven in front of deep cover for two
short of a length, at the hips, tucked away to midwicket
short of a length, no room, he opens the face, nearly plays it on, but they take a single as the ball makes its slow journey towards the keeper
short of a length, slower delivery, no room, pushed back to him
another slower ball, but on the pads, and is glanced fine of long leg for a couple
yorker, squeezed out wide of cover for one

he has hit him on the toe with a yorker. Perera is on his knees in pain, but he has survived the lbw shout. This is a mean yorker coming from the height it does, and it has hit the toe on the full. Down the leg it is headed. The physio comes out with his magic spray
short of a length, into the body, dropped into the leg side for a single. Perera runs okay
short of a length, no room, defended from the crease
short, not much pace behind it, and down the leg side. Pulled fine for an easy boundary

another run-out. The only way they seem to be able to get wickets today. Perera is out for 116. This is played towards long leg, they decide to come back for the second, but the throw comes to Perera's end, and is accurate. Perera, who has recently been hit on the toe. Irfan collects it, and while he has broken the wicket with his arm, it is still considered a part of the hand as long as the ball is in his hand. Perera was not the most urgent while taking the first. And yet again, it is Anwar Ali doing wonders in the outfield
short of a length, outside off, tries a flashy drive, is beaten
yorker first up for him. Chandi keeps it out
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
on a length, just outside off, driven past cover
good bouncer, Chandimal late into the hook from wide outside off. The top edge falls safe, just short of fine leg
slower ball, full outside off, mid-off is at the edge of the circle, and they take a single to that man
another bouncer, Chandimal ducks it this time
short of a length, angling in, opens the face late to get a single
short of a length, pretty straight, defended from the crease
tucked away off the hip for one
nice-looking late-cut, gets a single to third man
low full toss, dipping on him, gets the edge, goes to slip on the bounce
length ball, angling across him, beats the outside edge as Chandimal looks to cut
and he provides Pakistan some relief. This is a full and wide delivery, Thirimanne looks to squeeze this past point with an open face, but ends up hitting it straight to the man
short of a length, tucked away for a single to long leg
short of a length, outside off, dabs on it, finds backward point
slower ball, on a length, around off, opens the face to take a single to the left of point
on a length, outside off, punched to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, punched past the man diving at point. Gets a single
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
on a length, just outside off, angling across, beats Chandimal's attempt to drive
drives on the up as Irfan pitches up, and he has crunched this. Short cover gets a hand to it, but it still goes for four
lovely drive. This is not a half-volley by any stretch, but he has kept the drive all along the ground and placed it between mid-off and cover
yorker, just outside off, dug out to point
on a length, slower ball, around off, drops it towards short cover. Chandimal wants one, but is rightly sent back
yorker, just outside off, hit back to Rahat
another yorker, dug out to mid-off this time
short of a length, pitches leg, angles towards off, worked to leg for a single
bouncer, pretty straight, he sways out of its line
full, on off, squeezed out to cover
looks to hoick this to leg, is beaten and hit on the pad
short of a length, punched to deep midwicket

down the wicket and lofts this length ball over long-on for six. They have definitely spoken about this: attack Shah. Out of his crease in a flash, and not too close to the pitch of the ball, which gives him room to swing his arms
shortish, punched to long-on

Imad Wasim has hurt himself. Mathews looks for the big sweep, Shah fires this in, Mathews gets a massive top edge, Wasim at square leg thinks this is an easy catch as he back-paddles. But the wind. The win. It takes the ball away at the last moment, and Wasim has a bad fall with his head rebounding off the turf
short and wide, cut away for four. This is quite an ordinary delivery
googly, middle and leg, uses soft hands to bunt this towards deep midwicket, and takes the second
yorker, just outside off, dug out to short cover
on a length, middle and leg, pushed into the leg side for one
driven on the up as he pitches on a length. Gets a couple straight of deep cover
yorker gone wrong. The low full toss is pushed wide of long-on for two

Rahat gets another wicket. Slower ball this time. Chandimal sees one short of a length and looks to open the face, but this cutter deceives him and he is early into the shot. The edge settles with Sarfraz who dives forward
appeal for lbw as he beats the inside edge first ball, but this is headed down leg
short ball, but the quick pace surprises Mathews a little, and he just settles with the single to deep midwicket
short of a length again, picked away off the pads for one
slow through the air, tossed up, no turn. Defended back to him
even slower, 82ks, tossed up wide, Mathews stands still and drives. Finds point
flatter and too short. Pulled through midwicket for four. Shah has provided quite a few such deliveries today
goes back to tossing it up, concedes just the single to deep midwicket
yorker, just outside off, squeezed out to cover

oh this is cruel. The margins of error very little. Yorker goes wrong by inches. It is a low full toss, Mathews has flicked this without a back lift, and places it between mid-on and midwicket for four
on a length, on off, pushed into the covers for one
short of a length, angling in towards the top of off, defended
slower ball, nearly a yorker, dug out back to him
half-volley. Again only a slight error from that yorker length, and he has paid dearly. Siriwardana clears the front let and hits this to the left of long-off
short of a length, on off, punched wide of long-on
short of a length again, punched to deep midwicket
down the wicket to drive this to long-on
this is driven hard. Out of the crease early, takes this on the half-volley, and drills this straight of long-on. Anwar Ali makes the ground, but the bad bounce at the last moment beats him
slogged away for a six. This is tossed up. Pitches in his swinging zone. Doesn't turn at all. And he has sent it wide of long-on for a flat six
quick delivery, pushed back to him
short ball. Waist high. That is asking to be hit. Siriwardana sends it sailing over midwicket for a six
wide length ball, he stands his ground to maintain some room, drives it wide of deep cover for four all along the ground
low full toss, driven straight to deep cover for one
short, ordinary delivery outside leg. Called a wide
yorker, dug out to midwicket for one
low full toss outside off, deep cover has to field again
full toss, on off, makes room to drive this to deep cover for one
not a good start. A loosener on a length, and Mathews slogs this over wide long-on, past the outstretched hand of Shehzad, for a flat six
high full toss outside off, driven to deep cover
slower ball, outside off, pushed to extra cover for one
full toss. This over has gone all wrong. He has slugged this over midwicket for four. Pakistan have no clue what to do
low full toss, driven to extra cover. Wasim, the fielder, has a shy at the stumps, and Anwar's fingers are jammed with the half-volley throw
slower ball, full, on off, driven to long-off for one
length ball, slugged across the line, off the inside half of the bat it goes

wide full toss. Sri Lanka getting runs on a platter here. Mathews has just push-driven it wide of long-off for four. That's the fifty. A timely effort for the Sri Lanka innings after the hard work done by Perera and Dilshan
on a length. This is just ordinary bowling. Mathews opens up his body and drives it over extra cover
full and straight, nearly a yorker, dug out to point for one
low full toss, middle and leg, swiped to the left of deep square leg
yorker, runs off the inside half of the bat, straight to Yasir Shah at deep backward sqaure leg, where Shah shows no urgency, and Sri Lanka steal the second too
and they bowl length again. Mathews clubs this back over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four
length bowling again, driven in front of deep cover for two
slower ball, finally gets a mis-hit out of Mathews. Still concedes a single to long-on
nothing working for Pakistan. A top-edged four. Siriwardana premeditates and backs away. Anwar follows him with a short ball. The top edge, though, falls safe over square leg and rolls into the fence
slower full ball, and this is sweetly hit. The best area to hit in the town. Back over his head. Just a chip. And it carries all the way into the advertising triangles
short, offcutter, pulled to short fine for a single
makes room to slug a full ball wide of long-on for two
full ball, no room, but he has stayed back, got under it and hoicked it wide of long-on for four more
full and into the pads again, this time it goes off the inside half of the bat for just a single to leg
lovely shot. This is a slower ball, with no room available, but he makes room and dabs down on it and manages to place it between point and short third man
down the wicket, Rahat bowls short, he bunts it down for a single
full, on off, hacked to long-on for one
short, into the body, no room, pulled to long-on for one
full toss outside off, hit to deep point for just a single
top edge on the pull as Irfan bounces him. They get the single, though
yorker outside off, dug out to extra cover
another bouncer but this time Siriwardana has nailed the pull to send it over deep square leg for a six that brings up his fifty. Off just 25 balls
another bouncer, he looks to upper-cut, but is beaten. Finally a dot since the 44th over

inn2.comm: first ball is full and accurate, defended off the front foot
short of a length, outside off, he shuffles across to play this to cover
no-ball early in the innings. An effort delivery as Azhar walks down the wicket and is beaten down leg
seam movement back in beats Azhar's slog on the free hit, and his hit awkwardly just over the pad. On the side of the thigh pad
short of a length, angling in, punched away off middle and leg for a couple
but this one holds its line, which is what Balaji used to do every once in a while. Takes a soft thick outside edge for a single
another ball that holds its line, and beats the outside edge of Ahmed Shehzad
some shape away despite pitching it short of a length. Squares him up in defence
short of a length, holds its line outside off, punched to mid-off
shape away again, this time Azhar looks to force it into the off side, gets an inside edge to fine leg for one
short of a length, outside off, looks to play it to cover, gets an inside edge to leg
short of a length, slight movement away again. Defended square on the off side
on a length, on off, defended to mid-off
on a length, swinging in towards off stump, defended to leg
acrobatic one-handed take from Chandimal as this one swings too far down the leg side
swinging in towards off, uppishly pushed to cover
walks down the wicket, the ball swings in, and he lets it. Then he flicks it to leg
short of a length, outside off, defended from the crease
dropped at his feet for a single
more inswing, clipped to short midwicket
shapes away from just short of a length, and is left alone outside off
nicely punched but not past the electric fence at point called Dilshan, who dives to his right to save at least two runs here
fuller, shape away, pushed with soft hands towards mid-off for a single
down the wicket, Lakmal sees it and bounces him, and beats the top edge on the hook
short of a length, into the body, slightly early into it, uppishly defends this to the right of Lakmal
big wide down the leg side. A blemish on a good over
short of a length, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on for one
wide length ball, defended to cover
full toss outside off, Azhar just meets it with an open face and places it between cover and cover-point for four
short of a length, angling in, defended
more swing in towards the middle and leg stump, defended to leg again
walks down the wicket to work this shortish ball past midwicket for two
walks down the wicket again, Gamage bowls wide outside off, and he has to shuffle to meet it. Dilshan fields at point
short of a length, no room, defended back to him
looks to back away, Lakmal follows him, cramps him, defeats his shot, and then gives him a cold stare
short of a length, no room, defended from the crease
shuffles across and pulls a shortish ball wide of mid-on for two
makes room after shuffling across, but he cannot beat Dilshan at point. He is getting edgy here
beauty from Lakmal. Shehzad tries to sell him the dummy again by moving across and then backing away. Lakmal stays just short of a length, gets some movement away, and beats the bat
swing in again, hits the inside half of the bat on the drive. Mid-on fields
down the wicket, loses his shape as Gamage stays outside off, he mis-hits it to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, pushed to Dilshan to point. Don't even think of taking the single
finally he gets one out of the screws. Down the wicket again, turns this into a half-volley and lofts it over cover-point for four
short of a length, wide outside off, he moves across to run this down to third man
survives a mis-hit pull. You can see Shehzad is getting edgy. Here he top-edges a hook. T Perera runs back from mid-on, but the wind takes it away from him
tucked away off the hip, with the fine leg inside the circle. Slightly off line from Lakmal, and Azhar gets inside the line to place it fine
short of a length, straight, worked away square on the leg side for one
short of a length, no room, runs this down to third man for one
short of a length, at the stumps, pushed to mid-on for one
down the wicket backing away, and he follows him with a short ball and hits the bat as opposed to bat hitting the ball. Short fine leg fields
creamed it. Shuffles across and then opens up the front leg to smash this shortish delivery between mid-off and cover for four
wild swipe across the line after dancing down the wicket. The inswinger misses the bat and the stumps
length ball outside off, runs this down to third man for one
shuffles across, makes him bowl wide outside off, then opens up the front leg and clobbers this length ball through cover for four
does the same routine - shuffle across and then open the front leg. This time, though, he gets too under it. what saves him is, he has gone straight. Just about clears mid-off
good running. Makes room again, gets no room, bottom-edges it near his toes, and Azhar calls him through for one
another aerial shot falls safe. Pulled on the bounce to deep square leg
on a length, on off, defended
Azhar leaves the crease, takes a calculated risk, and even though this is not straight out of the middle of the bat, it sails over mid-off for four
really full, dug out into the leg side for one

Chandimal has stumped him. Or has he? Senanayake has got a wicket in his first over. Shehzad makes room to try to hit this over mid-off. The ball pitches on off, and keeps on going with the angle. Shehzad tries to slide back, but he is caught on the line. It's a tight call, but no part of the foot is behind the line
on a length, no turn, defended off the front foot
flighted outside off, pushed wide of cover for a single
short of a length, angling in towards top of off. Defended off the back foot
inswinger, middle and leg, defended to short midwicket
short of a length, outside off, pushed between cover-point and cover for a single
short of a length, turned away to short midwicket
short of a length, outside off, punched away, and Dilshan saves runs at point again
too short for his pace in the mid-120s. Azhar pulls it to the left of long leg and gets four for it
tossed up outside off, no turn, defended off the front foot
lovely shot. Effortless. Dances down the wicket, not too close to the pitch of the ball, and just chips it over mid-off in the circle. The timing and the breeze do the rest
gets the flatter ball after dancing down last ball. Punched straight to cover-point and take a suicidal run. Kusal Perera fumbles there, and misses out on a run-out
flighted outside off, driven to long-on
flighted outside off, uppishly played to short midwicket
laps this full ball to long leg for one
he won;t love this for sure. Hafeez walks down at him, takes a length ball on the half-volley and drives it past short cover for four all along the ground
left alone outside off this time
short of a length, on off, punched wristily, wide of mid-on for a single
where did that kick off from?. Short of a length, outside off, and kicks head high. Seems to have hit the edge of a grassy patch. Can't do anything with it

suicidal single. Pushed firmly and straight to mid-off, and he just sets off hoping there will be a misfield or an off-target throw. Mathews, though, hits the base of the stumps. Pressure showing on Pakistan
length ball outside off, pushed to deep cover
stays back to defend a length ball to leg
lovely shot. Pushes forward, sees the flat trajectory, rocks back and late-cuts this between point and cover-point for four
tossed up on off, defended right back to him
tossed up again, and defended back to him again
down the wicket, pulls the length back a little, defended to cover
slightly flatter, protecting the over, Hafeez opens the face, but can't beat cover-point
walks down the wicket first ball he faces, drops a shortish delivery to leg for one
short, asking to be hit at Perera's pace, and Hafeez has pulled this over midwicket for four
full outside off, nicely driven to short cover
on a length, just outside off, defended to mid-off this time
slower ball. Bowls it from deep inside his palm. Full, and drifts in late. Defended in front of off
lovely short-arm pull. Perera bowls short again. He has two men back. Long leg and Deep square. Hafeez, though, has pulled this bang in between those two men
stays back to play a length-ball offbreak back to Senanayake
sweeps this from around off for a single
nice little lap sweep for a single around the corner
flighted around off, driven to long-on for one
superb shot. Again sees the flatter trajectory and immediately rocks back to open the face and place this between point and cover-point. Reaches 5000 runs too
swept away to long leg for one this time
full, swinging in, pushed wide of mid-on for one
slower ball, short of a length, pretty straight, defended to leg
that's the third time he has bowled short in the last two overs, and all three times he has been pulled away for four. Sarfraz sees this early, and goes over midwicket
short of a length, outside off, chops on it, hits it to the right of third man, comes back for the second
slower ball, low full toss, driven to short cover where Senanayake is wrong-footed but recovers well
slower ball again, driven to short cover
drifting into the pads, they take a leg-bye
into the pads again, but this deflection goes straight to Chandimal. No leg-bye this time
more drift in from outside off, and Sarf inside-edges it into his pad
down the wicket to work this away from outside off. Takes a single to deep square
on a length, angling in towards top of off. Defended from the crease
short of a length, seams in, beats the edge, hits the pad. Good over for Sri Lanka. First since the end of the sixth to not go for at least one boundary
flights this up, gets some drift in, nearly beats his sweep. Concedes a single off the bottom edge
down the wicket, meets this on the half-volley, takes a single
dips on him, yorks him, dug out to leg
this is what part-timers can do. Just looks to sit back and defend a good over so far and bowls a long hop. Sarf rocks back to pull this over midwicket
he is playing with Siri now. Sweeps this length ball between deep square and long leg for four
flat arm ball again, and pulled towards deep midwicket for two
short of a length, holds its line, opens the face to place this past point for one
short of a length, drops this at his feet and steals a single. Seems to be standing outside his crease anyway
good bouncer, around off, head high, Hafeez sways out of its line
on a length, just outside off, defended with an open face

that's No. 100 for Mathews. not yet. Wait on. Hafeez has reviewed this lbw decision. Mathews bowls on a length, this nips back in front just outside off. Beats the inside edge, and hits him in front of middle and leg. There is no bat6 involved. It looks like going down leg, but since the umpire has given it, all the ball has to do is clip the leg stump. And clip it it does. Mathews gets his 100th, and what a big wicket it is too. Hafeez walks back shaking his head
bouncer first up, and Malik is hurried into swaying out of its line. Mathews is 2-0-3-1
slower ball, on a length, hit uppishly to the left of Perera
short of a length, on off, defended straight to Dilshan to point
short of a length, outside off, punched straight of third man for a couple
and straight of third man again, and he gets a couple again
on a length, headed towards top of off and middle. Has to defend it respectfully

lovely direct hit from third man. Lakmal is the man. They have taken two couples to his right already this over, and once again Sarfraz places it straight of that man. This time he cuts the angle, gets to the ball quicker, and lets rip a direct hit on the half-volley. Sarfraz is stunned, and caught short. Lovely replay. Ian Gould, the square leg umpire, enjoyed that piece of fielding
short of a length, just outside off, pushed in front of point for one
full, into the pads, driven past mid-on for a four first ball. That's a good way to check in. Just a push-drive
short of a length, outside off, defended to point
on a length, just outside off, defended to mid-off
short of a length, at the stumps, defended back to him
wide length ball, he drives hard, gets a thick outside edge to third man
that has kicked out of nowhere. This is the second time Perera has managed that today. From just short of a length it rises chest high. Rizwan looks to open the face but is beaten
length ball, angling in, mis-hit to mid-on
slight shape back in again, runs off the inside half of the bat for a single to midwicket
on a length, just outside off, defended back to him
short of a length, widish, cut away to third man on the bounce
on a length, shaping in, driven straight to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, placed to the right of third man. They take a comfortable second
short of a length, into the body, pushed past mid-on for two
short of a length, just outside off, punched to deep cover
short of a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, outside off, directs it to third man for one
bouncer, head high, Malik is late into the hook and this is too high to be able to control anyway, but the top edge flies over the keeper's head for four
full and straight, driven right back at Perera
wide length ball, runs off the thick outside edge for a single to third man
on a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot

Perera gets his wicket at his favourite ground. It's Malik who is out. Maybe he doesn;t like the dog. Just charges at a length ball, but is not close enough to the pitch of the ball. Ends up dragging it, and short midwicket takes the catch off the inside half of the bat
short of a length, pretty straight, runs it down to third man for one
short of a length, seams back in, hits the pad, but is headed down leg
edged but the slip is wide. Short of a length, holds its line, takes the edge, but Thirimanne is at 1.5 slip instead of first slip. Neither Chandimal nor Thirimanne can make this catch
some spice here from Lakmal. Again holds its line from just outside off, beats the edge this time
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to cover
wide length ball, and he has driven this superbly. Bisects cover and point with an open face. Four all along the ground
on a length, angling in towards top of off, defended to mid-off

this one nips back in from a similar area, and beats the edge to hit him around the thigh pad. He is doubled over. He is down. Seems to have been hit in that unprotected area around the thigh pad. Oh this is actually straight into the box
short of a length, rising towards the chest, fended from the crease
length ball outside off, left alone
short and wide, cut away in the air but past point for two. Rizwan is struggling to run after that blow
long hop[, pitched outside leg, and he pulls this majestically through midwicket for four
on a length, angling away, defended with an open face
driven on the up but straight to short cover
looks to lap sweep, the ball pitches leg and turns away to beat the shot. Not called a wide
swept away to long leg for one
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, defends to mid-on

huge lbw shout, not given and they haven't reviewed it. Looks out to me. More out than Hafeez. Straight ball, Wasim plays for turn, is hit pretty low in front of middle stump. Gould thinks it is angling too far down. They don't challenge him. The replays show Sri Lanka have got it wrong. The ball is hitting the leg stump
short, worked away to fine leg
tossed up, defended off the front foot
short of a length, defended
another short ball, and Wasim likes it. Pulls this through midwicket for four again
down the wicket, hits this over point, Siriwardana gets around from third man and manages to keep this in despite a fumble
his second no-ball tonight. Clear overstepping. Driven to mid-off
bouncer, pulled straight to deep midwicket. Caught but he can't be out off a free hit
a length ball outside off, driven on the up to deep cover
full, on off, defended to mid-off
short of a length, straight, defended to leg
full, nearly a full toss, swept away for a couple square on the leg side
down the wicket, right to the pitch of the ball and defends
slow in the air, pretty straight, dropped into the leg side for one

Senanayake had him last over, but he gets Wasim out again. This is just a gentle offbreak, Wasim is not close to the pitch of it just outside off, and plays in front of his body. Lofts it to the right of Senanayake who dives full length to take the catch
flighted on middle and leg, defended back to him
nice shot on the up, but Senanayake makes a diving save at cover to save three runs
on a length, just outside off, defended from the crease
slower ball, short of a length, beats the outside edge and bounces short of Chandimal
on a length, on off, pushed to mid-off
slower ball again, just outside off, defended with an open face
slower ball again, Anwar opens the face on it, but the lack of pace on the ball means it goes straight to point
lovely shot. Down the wicket, reaches the pitch of the ball, goes inside-out and clears mid-off
flatter, pushed through, looks to open the face, is beaten
slow through the air, defended into the covers for one
stays back for a length ball. The bat comes down in time in defence
stretches forward to push this down the ground, short straight cover dives and deflects it towards Senanayake. He needs a direct hit to catch Anwar short, but misses
stays back to work a length ball to leg for a single

Perera gets another on his favourite ground, and this is the specialist batsman, Rizwan. Perera bowls short of a length, on top of off, Rizwan goes back and looks to open the face, but manages just an edge through to Chandimal
looks to open the face to a wide length ball. Lucky he hasn't made any connection: there is a slip in place
wide length ball, pushed to cover
wide length ball, runs it down to third man for one
slower ball from deep inside the palm, drifts in but takes the inside edge before hitting the pad
slogged away from outside off. Across the line and dragged to midwicket for four
tossed up on off, defended off the front foot
defended off the front foot again
short, outside off, cut away to deep cover for one
flighted outside off, pushed wide of point for one
short of a length, he goes deep into the crease to cut, and edges it wide of slip for four
short again, into the body, worked away for a single
holds its line outside off, beats the outside edge
short of a length, angling in, worked into the leg side for one
length ball, angling in, driven on the up, between the bowler and mid-on for a four all along the ground
short of a length, outside off, opens the face to get a single to third man
full, outside off, holds its line, Shah stays inside the line
slightly shorter, and he goes back to cut it to deep point

Shah falls for 9. The first man out of the 15 that have batted today to not reach double figures. Senanayake flights one, Shah sees a big hit, jumps out of the crease, gets a thick edge for an overhead catch at short cover
tossed up outside off, defended back to him
stays back to defend a length ball
tossed up middle and leg, defended again
stays back to defend a flat delivery
stays back to defend a length ball that goes straight on. Ends a wicket-maiden

and now Sri Lanka are one wicket short. Gamage gets his first wicket of the night. This is short, pretty straight, and cramps him up as Anwar looks for a big shot. Can't get any power into the shot, and he just mis-hits it for a dolly to mid-on
short ball outside off, Irfan nonchalantly lets it go by just staying inside the line
a third no-ball from Gamage as he looks to bounce Irfan. Beats him on the hook but a free hit is coming up
another no-ball. Irfan makes room and swings, but fails to connect with the short ball. Gamage has overstepped again
a bouncer that follows Irfan, and beats the hook for a dot ball
he has slugged this powerfully. Four bouncers followed by a short ball, and he clears the front leg to crash this through midwicket
Irfan gies him the charge, Gamage bowls a fullie that is headed towards top of off, but Irfan just gets a touch of the bat
another bouncer, following Irfan again, and this time he bottom-edges it towards the keeper
flat length ball, Rahat stays back to defend
and Siriwardana gets a wicket to end the match. Flighted on off, Rahat looks for the bog hit, but all he manages is an aerial hit straight to long-off where Senanayake takes the catch
